explanation: The report is not correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 recommends using pointers to const when the pointee is not modified through that pointer, but that must be judged in the context of all uses of the pointer and the API. In this code: to_linux_device and metal_linux_dev_dma_map are static helpers that obtain the enclosing struct linux_device from a struct metal_device. Although the container_of implementation does not itself modify the object, the returned linux_device pointer is subsequently used in a call to ldev->ldrv->dev_dma_map (and likely other call sites) that expect a mutable struct linux_device *. Making to_linux_device return a const linux_device * (or changing metal_linux_dev_dma_map to take a const struct metal_device *) would not be obviously possible without changing those APIs and all call sites that mutate or expect a non-const linux_device. MISRA’s “whenever possible” requires that const qualification be applied only when it is compatible with all uses; here there is no evidence that the linux_device is never modified. Therefore the claim of a Rule 8.13 violation is unsupported.
